snippet: Ana Pérez, who was born in Cuba, learned to roll cigars from her father. She combines the skill with her looks and education making cigars at corporate functions and other events.
abstract: Ana Perez is one of eight young women employed by a company called Cigar Dolls to roll cigars at corporate functions and other events; Perez, who was born in Cuba and learned to roll cigars from her father, is unusual in a field that has been dominated by men for 500 years.
lead_paragraph: Ana Pérez, who was born in Cuba, learned to roll cigars from her father. She combines the skill with her looks and education making cigars at corporate functions and other events.

headline.seo: Female Cigar Roller Is a Rarity but Finds a Niche
headline.main: A Woman Finds a Niche in a Cuban Tradition
headline.print_headline: Rolling Cigars for an Audience and Carving Out a Niche
